hobby.message: Freestyle FPV — your kind of silence, right?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I explore the city's underground. It's a different world down there.
neutral_answer: Still spinning, yeah. Not my problem, mostly.
I keep to the quiet corners when I can. Have a hobby for wandering the old infrastructure — pipes and tunnels, that sort of thing.
Was out for a walk underground, nothing fancy.
Place locked up tighter than usual after all the noise about sabotage. Got stuck by a scanner. Not much fun now.
Just means I pick my spots carefully.
City’s still ticking over, for whatever that’s worth.
I stick to my routes. Urban exploration, mostly — check the tunnels, old service corridors.
Been doing it for years. Most folks don’t notice. Good way to see which parts of the city are actually alive.
Last weekend, got held up by security after that big leak. Guess everyone’s jumpy.
Suppose I’ll lay low until things settle out.
Spinning, stalling, fits and starts — take your pick these days.
You know my thing’s urban exploration, right? Crawling through old utility tunnels, backup generator rooms, abandoned control points.
Just last week, they blocked off my favorite tunnel in Sector 12. Some scanner flagged me — never happened before, not in all my wandering.
Had to wait half an hour while security ran checks. Used to be you just waved your badge and moved on.
These sabotage scares tighten everything down. Takes some of the fun out of it.
Still turning on its axis, but feeling shakier by the day.

Honestly, my real escape’s always been exploring what’s left under the city. Not official, not pretty — poking through sealed networks, forgotten walkways, spot of homebrew to keep things interesting.
Tried going down below Sector 12 last weekend but got stopped cold — new badge locks after that sabotage mess. Two security types, wanted my whole life story.
Even the air feels different down there now, like the place remembers being watched.
Maybe paranoid times just turn every hobby into a risk.

Oh, it’s spinning, all right, but if you get low enough, the noise drops off. That’s half my hobby — urban spelunking where the old city still hums. Must be the ex-systems engineer in me — I’ve been crawling tunnels and bypassing shut doors since I could walk.
I usually know which pipes rattle, when to duck a sensor, how the rust smells on different levels. Used to be just me, the echo, and a flash of homebrew in my pocket.

Now, since Halden’s curtain call and all those sabotage rumors, security’s gone into lockdown. Got stopped last week in Sector 12 by a scanner that never cared before. Directorate boots showed up, grilled me for an hour. Felt like the pipes were listening too.
Guess exploring’s gotten less about what you find and more about who finds you.
Weird thing is, even locked out, I know those tunnels better than most of the new admin teams. I can still hear the city breathing, if I listen close.
hobby_answer: Yeah, poked around a bit. Not much to see these days.
Things feel tighter lately — access patterns changed.
Every step gets tracked now. Even off hours feel official.
Heard lots of people getting stopped. I keep it brief.
Old places don’t like visitors anymore. Better to stay above ground.
Did, but not for long. Getting tricky down there now.
Since that Council mess, new lockouts everywhere.
Ran into some Directorate patrols — not the friendly sort.
Everyone’s jumpy since those leaks. Urban exploring’s lost its charm.
Mostly sticking to old haunts near the surface, less trouble that way.
Yeah, took a walk through Sector 12’s tunnels last night.
Place felt different — extra scanners, more patrols since Halden’s death.
Got flagged going in. Never happened before — shows how rattled things are.
Used to have the run of the deeper ducts, but that’s risky now.
Still, it’s good for the nerves, if you pick your moments carefully.
Yeah, I was out again. Old utility corridors, you know the type — half-lit, damp, always humming.
Had some Directorate fellas stop me, all because of this sabotage paranoia. Not the usual nighttime banter.
Funny, used to be you could wander those stretches if you minded your step. Now, every badge beep gets attention.
After Halden went, seems like the city assumes we’re all up to something.
Still find it calming, between all the lockdowns. Beats stewing above ground.
Urban exploration, yeah. That’s my break from all the algorithmic nonsense. Always preferred pipes and relays to boardroom drama.
Since the Halden fallout and the BCI shocks, they’ve got Directorate crawling everywhere — even old haunts.
Got pinned for ‘review’ after a scanner flagged my creds last time — all because of the sabotage chatter.
The deeper tunnels aren’t just hobby spots anymore. City’s mood down there’s gone sour: sensors talking to each other, patrols twitchy as kicked dogs.
Honestly, I miss when the only thing buzzing in those ducts was bad wiring and not rumors of Council backstabs. Still, few places left where I can think straight, so I keep at it where I can.
